thread.title: Inventors and InventHelp Clients Develops Improved Electronic Calendar (KPD-244)
thread.title_full: Inventors and InventHelp Clients Develops Improved Electronic Calendar (KPD-244) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Inventors and InventHelp Clients Develops Improved Electronic Calendar (KPD-244)
text:
InventHelp, a Pittsburgh-based invention submission company, is submitting the ECP - Z to companies for their review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 15, 2015
"Because society is so fast-paced and always on the move, things tend to be forgotten," said one of three inventors from Stroudsburg, Pa. "We came up with this unified device to keep everyone on the same page and up to date with events in their lives."
He developed the patent-pending ECP - Z to keep everyone on the same page with scheduling. The accessory prevents the user from forgetting about meetings, appointments and other events. It also makes it easier to share plans with others. The calendar can be accessed from virtually anywhere. This enhances organizational skills. Additionally, it is designed to reduce stress.
The original design was submitted to the King of Prussia office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-KPD-244, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
